LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-11T21:30:44Z Julie Glanville 2015-03-11T21:30:39+00:00 2015-03-11T21:30:39+00:00 HTAI 2015 pre-conference workshops https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HLG-MEMBERS;3dc8b5a3.1503 Reminder: Early-bird registration ends on April 1.<br><br>*PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITY FOR THOSE INTERESTED IN INFORMATION<br>RETRIEVAL FOR SYSTEMATIC REVIEWS, HTA AND OTHER EVIDENCE SYNTHESES!*<br><br>*Join us for two international full day pre-conference workshops*<br><br>*o**rganized by **the HTAi Interest Sub-Group on Information Resources<br>(IRG)* <http://www.htai.org/index.php?id=554><br><br>*Saturday June 13th - INTRODUCTION TO INFORMATION RETRIEVAL FOR HEALTH<br>TECHNOLOGY ASSESSMENT*<br><br>*AND*<br><br>*Sunday June 14th - ADVANCED INFORMATION RETRIEVAL FOR HTA:* [...] Elise Hasler (NCC-C) 2015-03-09T08:38:00+00:00 2015-03-09T08:38:00+00:00 HLG Newsletter - March issue now online https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HLG-MEMBERS;b1f3dbab.1503 *with apologies for cross posting*<br><br>The latest issue of the CILIP Health Libraries Group newsletter is now available online at:<br><br>http://www.cilip.org.uk/get-involved/special-interest-groups/health/pages/newsletter.aspx<br><br>Key items in this issue include:<br><br>Articles:<br><br>- Ipads on ward (Paediatric Diabetes) by Amanda Minns<br><br>Internet sites of interest:<br><br>- Head injury<br><br>Book Reviews:<br><br>- Kay, S. and Ennis, K. For example, Green Lane Mosque (30min into this video<br>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hhutQm5FTuY) have included sections in<br>several of their sermons on organ donation (in particular, challenging the<br>view that it is in conflict with Muslim teaching) and this resource (<br>http://www.donorrecovery.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/Organ-Donation-Sermon-ideas.doc)<br>looks at passages from various religious texts which could be used as the<br>foundation for teaching and discussion. For further<br>information, please contact Kate Misso - details below.<br><br>Job vacancy: Information Specialist<br><br>Full or part time, based in Escrick, York<br><br>Kleijnen Systematic Reviews (KSR) Ltd is an independent research company<br>that produces and disseminates systematic reviews and health technology<br>assessments of research evidence in health care. KSR was established in 2005<br>and is based in modern offices south of Escrick, York. [...] Catherine Voutier 2015-02-23T23:11:29+00:00 2015-02-23T23:11:29+00:00 A survey on library staff co-authorship and acknowledgement https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HLG-MEMBERS;c46d8f3d.1502 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We are writing to request your participation in a survey on library staff co-authorship and acknowledgement in publications. We are pursuing an understanding of the practice and attitude of librarians in regards to co-authorship and acknowledgement in publications for which they completed work.<br><br>The link to the survey: https://redcap1.mayo.edu/surveys/index.php?hash=1068c6e4c8051cfd4e9ea8072e3189e2<br><br>This is a research project and completion of this survey is completely voluntary. The research project and survey were reviewed by IRB and deemed exempt. We appreciate your time and effort in completing the survey, which will most likely take you 5 to 15 minutes to complete. We are not the finished article, but we are leading the way. The role includes the provision of high quality library and education services to all grades and disciplines of staff and students in order to support the delivery of effective patient care and to underpin the Trust's research agenda. We achieved 100% compliance with [...] Elise Hasler (NCC-C) 2015-01-15T15:36:23+00:00 2015-01-15T15:36:23+00:00 Book Review for HLG Newsletter https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HLG-MEMBERS;17d5d5d.1501 Hello all<br><br>I have a book available for review for inclusion in the next issue of the HLG Newsletter:<br><br>How to spot a dinosaur: Or how to survive and thrive in the workplace<br>Susie Kay and Kathy Ennis<br>http://www.amazon.co.uk/How-Spot-Dinosaur-Susie-Kay/dp/0956540120<br>Realising that your friends and colleagues don't all operate the same way that you do can be an eye-opener. How to spot a Dinosaur is an effective and practical guide to understanding and managing your business and personal relationships.<br>This book helps you identify the different personality types around you and offers ways to deal with the difficulties in working with [...] Sutton Sarah - Clinical Librarian 2015-01-15T10:46:55+00:00 2015-01-15T10:46:55+00:00 New Year - time to book yourself on an exciting workshop to make your library service visible and essential to users! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HLG-MEMBERS;7b897bc9.1501 Dear All<br><br>We still have some places left on our workshop, so book now to get a chance to share with colleagues who are facing the same challenges as you are: How to deliver excellent targeted services in resource challenged times, how to ensure that your customers know about the library and value its services. Move from New Year's resolutions to New Years actions! [...] Scarce, Margaret 2015-01-14T10:00:48-00:00 2015-01-14T10:00:48-00:00 Would you like to attend an international conference in 2015? Apply for a bursary now! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HLG-MEMBERS;ae0949bf.1501 Then why not apply for the Health Libraries Group Leslie Morton Bursary. The bursary gives up to \ufffd\ufffd1,000 for attendance at an international conference related to health librarianship, medical bibliography or medical history.<br>The Leslie Morton Bursary is a fantastic opportunity and is open to all members of CILIP's Health Libraries Group (HLG).<br>To find out more about the award and application process check the bursary website: Leslie Morton Bursary <http://www.cilip.org.uk/get-involved/special-interest-groups/health/awards/Pages/leslie-morton-bursary.aspx> .
